### native {#ab071132a634a15df871b6901c1375c90}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::sys::path::native (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; path, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; result, <a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49f">Style</a> style=Style::native)</>}>
Convert path to the native form.

This is used to give paths to users and operating system calls in the platform&#39;s normal way. For example, on Windows all &#39;/&#39; are converted to &#39;\\&#39;. On Unix, it converts all &#39;\\&#39; to &#39;/&#39;.

### extension {#ad1056825d31bf187d0be430c51aac281}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringRef llvm::sys::path::extension (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> path LLVM_LIFETIME_BOUND, <a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49f">Style</a> style=<a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49fa8e5f3adee38c8fccc13c1f3be0143796">Style::native</a>)</>}>
Get extension.

### is&#95;absolute {#ac35ec1dacb408d4c65d55249c0e02474}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sys::path::is&#95;absolute (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; path, <a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49f">Style</a> style=<a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49fa8e5f3adee38c8fccc13c1f3be0143796">Style::native</a>)</>}>
Is path absolute?

According to cppreference.com, C++17 states: &quot;An absolute path is a path
that unambiguously identifies the location of a file without reference to
an additional starting location.&quot;

In other words, the rules are: 1) POSIX style paths with nonempty root directory are absolute. 2) Windows style paths with nonempty root name and root directory are absolute. 3) No other paths are absolute.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="#a1dae3a7c3f46eaa1201a537367693f11">has&#95;root&#95;name</a>
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="#afbfbc19d8aa5dde440140c214c118516">has&#95;root&#95;directory</a>
</SectionUser>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="path"><a href="/docs/api/classes/input">Input</a> path.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if the path is absolute, false if it is not.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00671">671</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### is&#95;absolute&#95;gnu {#a892ec9d16a6daa5ed0965c36fc1caff7}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool llvm::sys::path::is&#95;absolute&#95;gnu (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp; path, <a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49f">Style</a> style=<a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49fa8e5f3adee38c8fccc13c1f3be0143796">Style::native</a>)</>}>
Is path absolute using GNU rules?

GNU rules are: 1) Paths starting with a path separator are absolute. 2) Windows style paths are also absolute if they start with a character followed by &#39;:&#39;. 3) No other paths are absolute.

On Windows style the path &quot;C:\\Users\\Default&quot; has &quot;C:&quot; as root name and &quot;\\&quot;
as root directory.

Hence &quot;C:&quot; on Windows is absolute under GNU rules and not absolute under
C++17 because it has no root directory. Likewise &quot;/&quot; and &quot;&quot; on Windows are absolute under GNU and are not absolute under C++17 due to empty root name.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="#a1dae3a7c3f46eaa1201a537367693f11">has&#95;root&#95;name</a>
</SectionUser>


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="#afbfbc19d8aa5dde440140c214c118516">has&#95;root&#95;directory</a>
</SectionUser>


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="path"><a href="/docs/api/classes/input">Input</a> path.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="style">The style of <code>path</code> (e.g. Windows or POSIX). &quot;native&quot; style means to derive the style from the host.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
True if the path is absolute following GNU rules, false if it is not.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00681">681</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### stem {#a1d074d016ff4ab25b0d504bf70a89059}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringRef llvm::sys::path::stem (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> path LLVM_LIFETIME_BOUND, <a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49f">Style</a> style=<a href="#a58cfd8a47c0ef96db27b451c2d6ec49fa8e5f3adee38c8fccc13c1f3be0143796">Style::native</a>)</>}>
Get stem.

If filename contains a dot but not solely one or two dots, result is the substring of filename ending at (but not including) the last dot. Otherwise it is filename.


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">/foo/bar.txt =&gt; bar</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">/foo/bar     =&gt; bar</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">/foo/.txt    =&gt; &lt;empty&gt;</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">/foo/.       =&gt; .</span></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><span class="doxyHighlight">/foo/..      =&gt; ..</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>



<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="path"><a href="/docs/api/classes/input">Input</a> path.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

<SectionUser title="Returns">
The stem of <em>path</em>.
</SectionUser>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp/#l00579">579</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/path-cpp">Path.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### system&#95;temp&#95;directory {#aa676374c59d0f44d25f9eab4bb824e5a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::sys::path::system&#95;temp&#95;directory (bool erasedOnReboot, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; result)</>}>
Get the typical temporary directory for the system, e.g., &quot;/var/tmp&quot; or &quot;C:/TEMP&quot;.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="erasedOnReboot">Whether to favor a path that is erased on reboot rather than one that potentially persists longer. This parameter will be ignored if the user or system has set the typical environment variable (e.g., TEMP on Windows, TMPDIR on &#42;nix) to specify a temporary directory.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="result">Holds the resulting path name.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
